urlData.desc: I decide to start my first coding challenge with a smiley face. I was messing around with CSS3 position, circles and smiley shapes, the outcome is quite cool!
urlData.title: Smiley Face

urlData.desc: I learn how to open / close the modal with jQuery to toggle CSS classes, use FontAwesome icons to make an animated battery-charging affect with setTimeout function.
urlData.title: Simple Modal Box

urlData.desc: I build a sample adventure blog for practice with the latest HTML5 and CSS3 features.
urlData.title: HTML5 Blog

urlData.desc: I use Sketch to create each animation frame as a separate image, with CSS keyframes to animate the background position and steps() to run the frame-by-frame walking effect.
urlData.title: A CSS Only Sprites Boy

urlData.desc: With CSS nth-child() selector and jQuery .css() method I made a simple click then change background color function.
urlData.title: Pick Your Favorite Color

urlData.desc: I create a pure CSS triangle (simple yet amazing) and use jQuery toggle() method to display / hide content.
urlData.title: A Simple FAQ: Journey to Mars

urlData.desc: This is a huge step forward to me, I try to challenge myself as much as possible. I create functions to random update ideas then insert the content into HTML. I also learned how to return the querystring part of a URL after the question mark. BTW, the page is also responsive using Bootstrap.
urlData.title: Random Creative Journal Ideas Generator

urlData.desc: This animation is composed of 2 layers, one is given a gray border and linear-gradient background, another is to create an overlay animated progress bar using keyframes property.
urlData.title: Gmail Progress Bar animation in pure CSS

urlData.desc: A pricing table design is responsive supported using bootstrap and hover effects with jQuery mouseover event.
urlData.title: Pricing Tables

urlData.desc: 4 flat slides with automatic sliding motion and manual controls in jQuery.
urlData.title: Simple Text Slider

urlData.desc: Instead of storing all ideas as an array of objects in js file, I refactor the original version a bit of code to practice how to load ideas as JSON data using AJAX.
urlData.title: Random Creative Journal Ideas Generator - AJAX version

urlData.desc: A CSS3 based tooltip, hover at brown text to get extra information.
urlData.title: Pop-up tooltips in article

urlData.desc: Another experiment using CSS transition and transform to create a tooltip on map.
urlData.title: Tooltip on map

urlData.desc: It's a simple chat box I made for fun. Have a chat with the bot when you type a response, it will quick to get back with you.
urlData.title: Funny Chat Messenger

urlData.desc: I learn how to create a basic form structure and design, add JS validation to check if one of the inputs is empty, if so then add the warning colored-border.
urlData.title: Shopping Checkout Form

urlData.desc: The image match game is built using mostly javascript, with functions to shuffle, lay out in the grid, flip cards and set scores.
urlData.title: Memory Game

urlData.desc: This is my first practice to build a website with 100% Bootstrap framework, including collapse navigation, modal popup previews and responsive timeline.
urlData.title: Animal Protection website with Bootstrap

urlData.desc: A Mac style text editor that saves automatically in localStorage and is responsive, if you refresh the page or leave and visit next time, the written text still there.
urlData.title: Autosave Text Editor

urlData.desc: I hope you enjoy this simple countdown for Christmas I made with snow falling effects in Javascript.
urlData.title: Christmas Countdown with Snowing

urlData.desc: This small notification is initially outside at the very left and top of the screen, then expanding into the page with jQuery animate() method.
urlData.title: Top Bar Notification

urlData.desc: This challenge is to create a simple filtering by data attribute values using jQuery, however the most difficult part of table layout would be RWD. Just drag window to see the effect, columns will collapse into a list on small screens.
urlData.title: Responsive Table Filter

urlData.desc: Simple table elements that handle Fahrenheit / Celsius calculator without submit button in jQuery.
urlData.title: Temperature Converter

urlData.desc: A responsive To-Do List App completed in vanilla javascript, with add, delete, mark completed and re-added functions.
urlData.title: To-Do List App

urlData.desc: Tap your keyboard to play the drum! It's all made with Vanilla Javascript. I learned about using keydown event handler and data attributes to interact with audio elements.
urlData.title: Drum Kit

urlData.desc: An animated accordion using CSS and jQuery. I make use of some DOM traversal methods to add a little indicator icon to show whether a section is expanded or collapsed.
urlData.title: Accordion Menu

urlData.desc: Scroll down the page to see fishes swimming around. While the background is fixed, with pageYOffset() property in javascript, I learned how to manipulate a parallax scrolling effect website.
urlData.title: Parallax Scrolling Aquarium

urlData.desc: With the help of CSS transform's rotate() property and Javascript's built in Date function, the functionality of the clock looks great, it has hour, minute and seconds hands move to display the current time.
urlData.title: JS + CSS Clock

urlData.desc: It's an auto-playing slideshow with navigation menu, including CSS fade transition and JS function to calculates the next slide to display.
urlData.title: A responsive fade effect slideshow

urlData.desc: What I enjoyed this challenge is that I learned how to define and override of CSS variables, filter properties and execute function to update the image's style.
urlData.title: Photo Editor with CSS Variables and JS

urlData.desc: This challenge is built with jQuery and Bootstrap framework. I use AJAX to get Github's user infos and repositories, $.each() function to loop through each results and display it on the page.
urlData.title: Github User Finder

urlData.desc: Instead of just using HTML5's built-in browser validation, I add additional custom rules to check the inputted value as well. It's a real-time validation using test() method to test for a match in RegExp, the feedback is displayed without submitting the form.
urlData.title: HTML5 Form Validation with jQuery

urlData.desc: Pig is a basic dice game completed in pure JS, the first player to score 100 wins the game. I learn how the dice value changes to a new random number each time, with conditional statements to check if all of rules apply.
urlData.title: Pig Dice Game
